title: cmd/go: LANG environment variable affect go build under a cgo package
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
go version go1.6.2 linux/amd64

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN=""
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH="/home/pirate/go_path:/home/pirate/code/arpgserver"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/usr/local/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/usr/local/go/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT="1"
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"

3. What did you do?
If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error.
A complete runnable program is good.
A link on play.golang.org is best.

execute go build under a cgo package

4. What did you expect to see?
with LANG=zh_CN.UTF-8 compiler complains "-no-pie" not supported by gcc/g++
with LANG=en_US.UTF-8 ok

5. What did you see instead?
